body.p: To his excellency Beriah Magoffin -- Governor of Ky -- your petitioner George N. Brown states that he and Jacob Rice went Bail for James C Fraishiers appearance on the first day of the Greenup circuit court at the last July -- Term who was indited for an assault in said court -- your petitioner says that said Frashier failed to make his appearance and forfeited his said Bond which was for $100, at the Last November Term $ 1860 -- judgmt was rendered against your petitioner for said sum. He states that cause proceeded to trial against said Frashier and judgmt had -- he states that at the Term your petitioner was bound for his appearance said Frashier was crippled and with somuch so that was unable to attend -- that he resided in the county of Lawrence Ky -- and that it was utterly impossible for him to get to said court in discharge of said recognizance -- In consideration of the premises he ask your excellency to remit said fine -- Frashier is poor and unable to discharge the Bond --

Jany 29th 1860 --
we hope your excellency will interpose in behalf of the petitioners.

Jas. M. Rice
Jno M Rice

Greenup
cir Ct
G. N. Brown &c
J. Rice
